definition: to give in charity/to give alms (to the poor)
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: A man was sitting at a corner, with a hat in each hand, waiting for handouts.
sentences.chinese: 一个人坐在墙角处，两手各托一顶帽子，乞求施舍。

sentences.english: But when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doeth
sentences.chinese: 你施舍的时候，不要叫左手知道右手所作的。

sentences.english: No one could give King Moth a competent pair of wings, but themselves.
sentences.chinese: 没有谁能够施舍给帝王蛾一双奋飞的翅膀。

sentences.english: What do you think about giving money to beggars?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎样看待施舍钱财帮助乞丐呢？

sentences.english: What did I into mistress by people alms, became a no position of the dodger.
sentences.chinese: 靠人施舍，成了一个没地位的寄生者。

sentences.english: The Moslems must give alms generously and provide for the poor.
sentences.chinese: 穆斯林必须慷慨施舍帮助穷人。

sentences.english: No one I’ve met is looking for a handout.
sentences.chinese: 在我见到的人中，没有一个人乐意接受施舍。

sentences.english: Amy says it will not accept ZhangHePing alms.
sentences.chinese: 艾米表示不会接受张和平的施舍。

sentences.english: As an unashamed handout, the scheme has many critics.
sentences.chinese: 作为一种不加掩饰的施舍，这一计划受到很多批评。

sentences.english: Do not accept any hand-outs and replace.
sentences.chinese: 不接受任何的施舍和代替。

sentences.english: Charity is as bad as brigandage. Charity is really just as unfair to the recipient as to the donor.
sentences.chinese: 施舍和掠夺一样可恶，对捐献者和接受者都有失公平。

sentences.english: Ramadan teaches Muslims self-discipline, humility and giving.
sentences.chinese: 斋月让人们懂得自律，仁慈和施舍。

sentences.english: It's not that 'Father Chavez' is always going to give us handouts.
sentences.chinese: ‘圣父查韦斯’并不总是给予我们施舍。

sentences.english: Food pantries and soup kitchens all over the country have seen demand for their services soar.
sentences.chinese: 全国各地食物站和施舍处的服务需求量在不断攀升。

sentences.english: Once two poor women came to her in her castle, and begged for alms.
sentences.chinese: 一次两个可怜的女人来到她的城堡前，祈求施舍。

sentences.english: Every morning they must go on their alms round.
sentences.chinese: 每天早晨僧人要轮流获得施舍。

definition: emergency relief/to help the needy with cash or goods
to donate/to give/to grant/to distribute/to administer
to go begging/to ask for alms
to seek for/to hope to gain/desirous
